Package org.radarbase.management.service

Class UserService

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.radarbase.management.service.UserService

@Transactional
public class UserService
extends java.lang.Object
    Service class for managing users.

    • Method Detail

      • activateRegistration

        public java.util.Optional<User> activateRegistration​(java.lang.String key)
        Activate a user with the given activation key.
        Parameters:
        key - the activation key
        Returns:
        an Optional which is populated with the activated user if the registration key was found, and is empty otherwise.

      • completePasswordReset

        public java.util.Optional<User> completePasswordReset​(java.lang.String newPassword,
                                                      java.lang.String key)
        Update a user password with a given reset key.
        Parameters:
        newPassword - the updated password
        key - the reset key
        Returns:
        an Optional which is populated with the user whose password was reset if the reset key was found, and is empty otherwise

      • requestActivationReset

        public java.util.Optional<User> requestActivationReset​(java.lang.String login)
        Find the deactivated user and set the user's reset key to a new random value and set their reset date to now. Note: We do not use activation key for activating an account. It happens by resetting generated password. Resetting activation is by resetting reset-key and reset-date to now.
        Parameters:
        login - the login of the user
        Returns:
        an Optional which holds the user if an deactivated user was found with the given login, and is empty otherwise

      • requestPasswordReset

        public java.util.Optional<User> requestPasswordReset​(java.lang.String mail)
        Set a user's reset key to a new random value and set their reset date to now.
        Parameters:
        mail - the email address of the user
        Returns:
        an Optional which holds the user if an activated user was found with the given email address, and is empty otherwise

      • createUser

        public User createUser​(UserDTO userDto)
        Add a new user to the database.

        The new user will not be activated and have a random password assigned. It is the responsibility of the caller to make sure the new user has a means of activating their account.

        Parameters:
        userDto - the user information
        Returns:
        the newly created user

      • updateUser

        public void updateUser​(java.lang.String firstName,
                       java.lang.String lastName,
                       java.lang.String email,
                       java.lang.String langKey)
        Update basic information (first name, last name, email, language) for the current user.
        Parameters:
        firstName - first name of user
        lastName - last name of user
        email - email id of user
        langKey - language key

      • updateUser

        public java.util.Optional<UserDTO> updateUser​(UserDTO userDto)
        Update all information for a specific user, and return the modified user.
        Parameters:
        userDto - user to update
        Returns:
        updated user

      • getUserWithAuthorities

        @Transactional(readOnly=true)
public User getUserWithAuthorities()
        Get the current user.
        Returns:
        the currently authenticated user, or null if no user is currently authenticated

      • removeNotActivatedUsers

        @Scheduled(cron="0 0 1 * * ?")
public void removeNotActivatedUsers()
        Not activated users should be automatically deleted after 3 days.

        This is scheduled to get fired everyday, at 01:00 (am). This is aimed at users, not subjects. So filter our users with *PARTICIPANT role and perform the action.

      • findUsers

        public org.springframework.data.domain.Page<UserDTO> findUsers​(UserFilter userFilter,
                                                               org.springframework.data.domain.Pageable pageable)
